links.title: Fediverse - Wikipedia
links.description:
The Fediverse (a portmanteau of "federation" and "universe") is an ensemble of federated (i.e. interconnected) servers that are used for web publishing (i.e. social networking, microblogging, blogging, or websites) and file hosting, but which, while independently hosted, can communicate with each other. 
On different servers (instances), users can create so-called identities. These identities are able to communicate over the boundaries of the ins...

links.title: A Closer Look at 'Anti-inflammatory' Diets
links.description: Certain foods, due to their effect on blood sugar levels, precipitate the release of molecules which are associated with inflammation. Excessive consumption of refined carbohydrates, french fries or soda isn't going to trigger that response. While those who eat this way may have significant negative health issues, it won't be due to so-called “inflammatory” foods. To suggest so is junk-science and a lack of common sense.

links.title: High income improves evaluation of life but not emotional well-being
links.description: Recent research has begun to distinguish two aspects of subjective well-being.
